ETYMOLOGY: From French terrain, from Vulgar Latin terranum, from Latin terra 'earth'.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A stretch of land, especially with regard to its natural or physical features.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一片陆地，尤指其自然或物理特征。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The mountainous terrain made the hike challenging.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 多山的地形使徒步旅行充满挑战。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A particular type of ground or surface, especially in relation to its suitability for travel, military operations, or virtual environments.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 特指某种类型的地面或地表，尤其是就其是否适合旅行、军事行动或虚拟环境而言。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The tank was designed to handle very rough terrain.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这辆坦克被设计用来应对非常崎岖的地形。
